Text.Value: *The thrum quickens, rising, cresting on a single feeling, a location.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A flash of the elder brain underwater that flickers, settles, then disappears.

Text.Value: You know Baldur's Gate best - how do we find this Morphic Pool?
The same way one gets to the bowels of anything - the sewers.
*The Netherstones pulse with psionic energy - permeating you, pulling you in line with their rhythm.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player]The stone sudddenly float out of the player hands and began to float in front of them. Player blinks, stand up and flinch back in surprise because of this.

Text.Value: Once we cross into the elder brain's domain, there will be no turning back.
You are right to be cautious. A fight with the most powerful being in all the Realms is not to be entered into ill-prepared.
With the stones in hand and the Chosen dead, we stand as good a chance as we ever will.
You have done very well indeed.
There it is. So innocent, but such potential.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] holding netherstone with right hand, idling loop
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of netherstone in player's hand.

Text.Value: Do you think we're ready to face the elder brain?
To conceal it, one would imagine.
Finish your business here before you proceed. The brain will be waiting for us.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Emperor] turns around and float back to portal.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor exits through the portal it came through.

Text.Value: But a word of caution - once we cross into the elder brain's domain, there will be no turning back.
I'm not ready.
The last stone - I need to see it for myself.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*REUSE*[Player] may reuse existing consturction anims[Emperor] float out
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player prises final netherstone from Gortash's corpse. (Focus on player rather than corpse.)
Portal opens up, Emperor steps out.

Text.Value: You have done very well indeed.
*The Netherstones pulse with psionic energy - permeating you, pulling you in line with their rhythm.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player]The stone sudddenly float out of the player hands and began to float in front of them. Player blinks, stand up and flinch back in surprise because of this.
EditorData.logicalname: Gortash stone last + obtained in Morphic Pool

Text.Value: We should go back to the undercity docks.
When we reach the Pool, we will find the brain and we will end this - in death, thralldom, or freedom.
As I expected, the docks under the city must lead to a Morphic Pool - that's where the Chosen imprisoned the brain.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player pockets the Netherstone/puts it away.

Text.Value: The last stone - I need to see it for myself.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*REUSE*[Player] may reuse existing consturction anims[Emperor] float out
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player prises final netherstone from Gortash's corpse. (Focus on player rather than corpse.)
Portal opens up, Emperor steps out.

Text.Value: We will end this - one way or another - in death, thralldom, or freedom.
So we have the final stone - I need to see it for myself.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*REUSE*[Player] may reuse existing consturction anims[Emperor] float out
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player prises Netherstone from Orin's dagger. (Focus on player, not the dagger.)
Portal opens up, Emperor steps out.

Text.Value: There it is. So innocent, but such potential.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] holding netherstone with right hand, idling loop
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of netherstone in player's hand.

Text.Value: So how do we get to the Morphic Pool?
If memory serves, there are smuggling routes beneath the city - they will take you underground.
As to how good a chance that is - I cannot say. But I have hope.
Why would they put it there?
A Morphic Pool beneath the city itself. So that's where the Chosen imprisoned the brain.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player pockets the Netherstone/puts it away.

Text.Value: There it is - the Morphic Pool. The place where the Chosen imprisoned the brain. That is where we must go.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player pockets the Netherstone/puts it away.

Text.Value: *The thrum quickens, rising, cresting on a single feeling, a location.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A flash of the elder brain underwater that flickers, settles, then disappears.

Text.Value: And to maintain the illusion of their own control above ground.

Synopsis:
The player has the last Netherstone, triggering a dialog with the Emperor to point them towards the Netherbrain. Main pieces of info he communicates here:

- The player has met the requirements needed to enter end game
- This trip is one-way
- Frame the upcoming confrontation with the Netherbrain in Morphic Pool 
- Where to find the boat
